title: The Clocksmith's Hiccup
description: Time itself is skipping in the North-Ward...

turns.narrative: Master Valerius’s clock-shop is a cacophony of rhythmic ticking, but the main tower-clock has developed a stutter.
turns.convergence: Every third second, time seems to 'skip' in the room, making your heart miss a beat.

turns.narrative: The smell of stale grease and ozone fills the air. The clock-hand is twitching at exactly 12:00:03 like a nervous finger.
turns.convergence: The skip intensifies, and suddenly you are standing on the ceiling, gravity reversed in the blink of an eye.

turns.narrative: From your new vantage point, you see a 'Time-Mite'—a creature of gear-teeth and silver shadow—chewing on the second hand.
turns.choice_b: Lure it with a copper coin
turns.convergence: The Mite chitters and vanishes, appearing three seconds in the future across the room.

turns.narrative: You have to anticipate its next 'jump'. The clock-face is now glowing with a frantic, shifting violet light.
turns.convergence: You catch the Mite as it materializes, its body cold as a winter's night.

turns.narrative: The Mite isn't a pest; it's a 'Chronal-Leak' shaped by the clocksmith's grief. He’s trying to rewind the day his daughter left.
turns.convergence: Valerius weeps, and the clock-room returns to normal gravity, though the skip remains in the air.

turns.narrative: He gives you a 'Stop-Watch'—a device that can pause a single falling drop of water. 'For the gaps in time,' he says.
turns.convergence: The ticking returns to a steady, comforting rhythm. The Mite has become a silver-stain on the floor.

turns.narrative: The tower-clock chimes four, the sound deep and resonating throughout the North-Ward. It sounds like a heart beating again.
turns.choice_b: Check the gears one last time
turns.convergence: You find a 'Silver-Sprocket' in the dust, etched with a name: 'Elara'.

turns.narrative: Valerius smiles at the sprocket. 'She was the best clocksmith I ever knew.' The air in the shop feels lighter now.
turns.convergence: The sun sets, its light coloring the brass gears in shades of deep copper and rose.

turns.narrative: You step out into the evening, the 'stutter' in your step finally gone. The North-Ward feels more solid, more present.
turns.convergence: The clock towers chime in unison, a perfect, logical harmony.

turns.narrative: Quest ends at theRidge. Time flows forward, steady and true.

conclusion: The mission regarding 'The Clocksmith's Hiccup' is complete. Quest Complete.

risk_matrix.penalty: You are stuck in a 3-second loop forever. (Quest Failed)
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: North-Ward clock tower develops audible stutter

permanent_effects.settlement: Tower clock stable; North-Ward time reliable again
